philosophy: The unexamined life is not worth living. - Socrates
Happiness depends upon ourselves. - Aristotle
Man is the measure of all things. - Protagoras
The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing. - Socrates
To know oneself is the beginning of all wisdom. - Aristotle
Life must be understood backward. But it must be lived forward. - Kierkegaard
What is rational is actual, and what is actual is rational. - Hegel
Without music, life would be a mistake. - Nietzsche
Liberty consists in doing what one desires. - John Stuart Mill
The state is that great fiction by which everyone tries to live at the expense of everyone else. - Bastiat
Do not fear death, but rather the unlived life. - Natalie Babbitt
Existence precedes essence. - Jean-Paul Sartre
We are our choices. - Sartre
The price of greatness is responsibility. - Winston Churchill
The mind is everything. What you think you become. - Buddha
Virtue is harmony. - Pythagoras
He who has a why to live can bear almost any how. - Nietzsche
The good of man is an activity of the soul in conformity with excellence or virtue. - Aristotle
Act only according to that maxim whereby you can, at the same time, will that it should become a universal law. - Kant
The purpose of life is not happiness: it is usefulness, to be honorable, to be compassionate. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar. - Abraham Lincoln
Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized. - Osho
Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued. - Socrates
Man is born free, and everywhere he is in chains. - Rousseau
An eye for an eye will leave the whole world blind. - Mahatma Gandhi
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit. - Aristotle
Justice is the constant and perpetual will to allot to every man his due. - Justinian I
The punishment of wise men who refuse to take part in the affairs of government is to live under the government of bad men. - Plato
Morality is not properly the doctrine of how we may make ourselves happy, but how we may make ourselves worthy of happiness. - Kant
Time is a created thing. To say 'I don’t have time' is to say 'I don’t want to.' - Lao Tzu
I think, therefore I am. - René Descartes
You cannot step twice into the same river. - Heraclitus
God is dead. - Nietzsche
Happiness is not an ideal of reason but of imagination. - Kant
To learn who rules over you, simply find out who you are not allowed to criticize. - Voltaire
That government is best which governs least. - Henry David Thoreau
He who opens a school door, closes a prison. - Victor Hugo
Power tends to corrupt, and absolute power corrupts absolutely. - Lord Acton
The only thing I know is that I know nothing. - Socrates
The goal of life is living in agreement with nature. - Zeno of Citium
Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do. - Voltaire
All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them. - Galileo
Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. - Lao Tzu
Knowledge is power. - Francis Bacon
The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others. - Mahatma Gandhi
Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail. - Emerson
The measure of intelligence is the ability to change. - Einstein
The meaning of life is to give life meaning. - Viktor Frankl
technology: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic. - Arthur C. Clarke
Technology is best when it brings people together. - Matt Mullenweg
The science of today is the technology of tomorrow. - Edward Teller
The human spirit must prevail over technology. - Albert Einstein
It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity. - Einstein
Technological progress has merely provided us with more efficient means for going backward. - Aldous Huxley
adventure: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all. - Helen Keller
humor: I'm not arguing, I'm just explaining why I'm right.
